all_procs.procedure_1.csv:
item,phasetype,survey,max_time,text,notes,shuffle_1,task_title,task_body_text,weight, 0,uor_cover,,user,Welcome,no_mobile,off,,,, 0,ws_zoom,,user,,,off,,,, 0,jans_infoconsent,,user,Janschewitz Replication - Taboo Only,,off,,,, 0,task_bookend,,user,Start,,off,Word Ratings,"

In this study we are interested in how people perceive words. For the next task, you will be given a list of 120 words - one at a time - and your task is to rate each word according to the scales presented.

Please be as honest as possible in your judgments; they are very important to us! Work at a rapid pace and don't spend too much time on each word. Make your ratings based on your first reaction to the word.

The words are presented in four blocks of 30 words, and you will be given a break after each block.


When you are ready, please press Start to begin.

",, 2 to 31,jans_ratings,,user,,,Random,,,, 0,task_bookend,,user,Start Block 2,,off,Time For A Break,"

Thank you for rating the first 30 words, when you are ready please press Start Block 2 to move onto the second block of 30 words. Once again, please be as honest as possible in your judgments; they are very important to us! Work at a rapid pace and don't spend too much time on each word. Make your ratings based on your first reaction to the word.

",, 32 to 61,jans_ratings,,user,,,Random,,,, 0,task_bookend,,user,Start Block 3,,off,Time For A Break,"

Thank you for rating the second 30 words, when you are ready please press Start Block 3 to move onto the third block of 20 words. Once again, please be as honest as possible in your judgments; they are very important to us! Work at a rapid pace and don't spend too much time on each word. Make your ratings based on your first reaction to the word.

",, 62 to 91,jans_ratings,,user,,,Random,,,, 0,task_bookend,,user,Start Block 4,,off,Time For A Break,"

Thank you for rating the third 30 words, when you are ready please press Start Block 4 to move onto the final block of 30 words. Once again, please be as honest as possible in your judgments; they are very important to us! Work at a rapid pace and don't spend too much time on each word. Make your ratings based on your first reaction to the word.

",, 92 to 121,jans_ratings,,user,,,Random,,,, 0,task_bookend,,user,Start,,off,Individual Diffierences,"

Thank you for rating all 120 words. We are now going to ask you to complete two questionnaires. One relates to trait aggression and the other to trait anger. All answers you give are entirely anonymous and cannot be traced back to you, so please be honest in how you respond.


When you are ready, please press Start to begin.

",, 0,tde_survey,trait_anxiety.csv,user,,,off,,,, 0,tde_survey,trait_anger.csv,user,,,off,,,, 0,task_bookend,,user,Start,,off,Demographics,"

Thank you for completing the 2 individual difference questionnaires. You have now completed all the experimental tasks. The last thing we require is to just collect some basic demographic information about you so we can better understand who has taken part in our study.


When you are ready, please press Start to begin.

",, 0,tde_survey,jans_demo.csv,user,,"Phase.set_timer(function(){     $("".sona_item"").attr('maxlength','8');   },250);",off,,,, 0,upload_data,,6,,Uploading REDCap Markers,off,,,, 0,jans_debrief,,user,Janschewitz Replication - Taboo Only,,off,,,,

trait_anxiety.csv:
Trait Anxiety Scale



INSTRUCTIONS: A number of statements which people have used to describe themselves are given below. Read each statement and then circle an answer sheet to indicate how you generally feel. There are no right or wrong answers. Do not spend too much time on any one statement, but give the answer which seems to describe how you generally feel.
4. l wish I could be as happy as others seem to be
8. I feel that difficulties are piling p so that I cannot overcome them
9. I worry too much over something that really doesn't matter
17. Some unimportant thought run through my mind and bothers me
18. I take disappointments so keenly that I can't put them out of my mind
20. I get in a state of tension or turmoil as I think about my recent concerns and interests
trait_anger.csv:
Trait Anger Scale



A number of statements which people have used to describe themselves are given below. Read each statement and indicate how you generally feel by selecting the appropriate response option
4. l get angry when slowed down by others' mistakes...
5. I feel annoyed when not given recognition for going good work...
7. I say nasty things when mad...
8. It makes me furious when I am criticised in front of others...
9. I feel like hitting someone when frustrated...
10. I feel infuriated when I do a good job and get a poor evaluation...
jans_demo.csv:
Demographic Information



Please could you help us better understand the diversity and inclusivity of our participants (and thus how well our data is applicable to the general population) by completing the questions below.

Questions 1-5 are optional, you do not have to answer if you wish (please select "Prefer not to say", if that is the case). You are required, however, to answer question 6, as we cannot include your data in the final dataset if you are not a native English speaker due to the differences in emotional processing of swearwords that occurs in non-native speakers.

1. Please enter your age (in years)
(the input only accepts numbers e.g., 21)
2. Which gender identity do you identify most with:
Male|Female|Non-binary|Trans|Prefer to self-identify|Prefer not to say
4. What is the highest level of education you have completed?
GCSEs or equivalent|A-Levels or equivalent|University undergraduate (e.g., BSc)|University postgraduate (e.g., MSc)|Doctoral degree|Other|Prefer not to say
5. What is your current employment status?
Full-time employment|Part-time employment|Unemployed/Retired/Full-time education|Prefer not to say

6. Are you a native British English Speaker
(defined as someone who was born and raised in the UK,
or moved to the UK before the age of 2)

7. How religious do you consider yourself to be?
(1 = Not Religious, 9 = Devout)

7. When I swear outloud in response to pain/frustration, how out of control do you feel?
(1 = Very out of control, 9 = Very in control)
